remixlab.proscene

Class ModelObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • remixlab.proscene.ModelObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Grabber, Model

    public abstract class ModelObject
extends Object
implements Model
    Model object which eases third-party implementation of the Model interface.

    Based on the concrete event type, this model object splits the performInteraction(BogusEvent) method into more specific versions of it, e.g., performInteraction(DOF6Event), performInteraction(KeyboardEvent) and so on. Thus allowing implementations of this abstract ModelObject to override only those method signatures that might be of their interest.

    See Also:
    Grabber.performInteraction(BogusEvent)

      • draw

        public boolean draw(PGraphics pg)
        Description copied from interface: Model
        While displaying a model requires the drawing to be rendered into Scene.pg(), picking requires it to be rendered into Scene.pickingBuffer() (see Scene.drawModels() and Scene.drawModels(PGraphics), resp.).

        For an implementation refer to the ModelObject and InteractiveFrame classes.

        Returns true if succeeded and false otherwise.

        Specified by:
        draw in interface Model
        Parameters:
        pg - PGraphics buffer used to draw the PShape instance.
        See Also:
        Scene.drawModels(), Scene.drawModels(PGraphics)

      • addGraphicsHandler

        public void addGraphicsHandler(Object obj,
                               String methodName)
        Attempt to add a graphics handler method to the InteractiveFrame. The default event handler is a method that returns void and has one single PGraphics parameter. Note that the method should only deal with geometry and that not coloring procedure may be specified within it.
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to handle the event
        methodName - the method to execute in the object handler class
        See Also:
        removeGraphicsHandler(), invokeGraphicsHandler(PGraphics)

      • removeGraphicsHandler

        public void removeGraphicsHandler()
        Unregisters the graphics handler method (if any has previously been added to the Scene).
        See Also:
        addGraphicsHandler(Object, String), invokeGraphicsHandler(PGraphics)

      • hasGraphicsHandler

        public boolean hasGraphicsHandler()
        Returns true if the user has registered a graphics handler method to the Scene and false otherwise.
        See Also:
        addGraphicsHandler(Object, String), invokeGraphicsHandler(PGraphics)

        Description copied from interface: Grabber
        Defines the rules to set the grabber as an agent input-grabber.
        Specified by:

      • checkIfGrabsInput

        public boolean checkIfGrabsInput(MotionEvent event)
        Calls checkIfGrabsInput() on the proper motion event: DOF1Event, DOF2Event, DOF3Event or DOF6Event.

      • checkIfGrabsInput

        public final boolean checkIfGrabsInput(float x,
                                       float y)
        A model object is selected using 'ray-picking' with a color buffer (see Scene.pickingBuffer()). This method compares the color of the Scene.pickingBuffer() at (x,y) with getColor(). Returns true if both colors are the same, and false otherwise.

      • grabsInput

        public boolean grabsInput(Agent agent)
        Check if this object is the Agent.inputGrabber(). Returns true if this object grabs the agent and false otherwise.

      • grabsInput

        public boolean grabsInput()
        Checks if the frame grabs input from any agent registered at the scene input handler.
